div.p: EXCELLENCE of CHARACTER IN a PERSON.
1. The current general term for salient features and principles of charismatic moral potency, integrity and generosity is dé 德, when used as a term of ethical evalutation.

2. Other general terms for subjectively construed general moral commendation include měi 美 "point of moral distinction" (ant. è 惡 "point of moral decrepitude"), and occasionally gāo 高 "elevated points, elevated spirit" (ant. jiàn 賤 "point of vulgar decrepitude"). NB that shàn 善 "excellent" is not used as a general term of positive moral appreciation in pre-Buddhist texts.
3. The most current dé 德 "virtues" recognised in pre-Buddhist China are rén 仁 "kind-heartedness", yì 義 "rectitude", lǐ 禮 "propriety", zhì 智 "wisdom", and xìn 信 "good faith".

4. Further important virtues are xiào 孝 "filial piety", zhōng 忠 "loyal diligence", tì 悌 / 弟 "brotherly affection", lián 廉 "impeccable probity", jié 節 "moderation", and perhaps yǒng 勇 "the courage of one's moral convictions". ( 說苑 : 百行 (xìng) 孝為先 )

5. Zhōng yōng 中庸 "the mean in action" may be mentioned as a a central Confucian virtue, jiān ài 兼愛 "unIversal love" as a Mohist virtue, wú wéi 無為 "unobtrusive action" as a non-moralistic Taoist virtue.
道，側重於做人所應遵循的道理。
德，人最根本最優秀的內在品質。
操，節操，側重於自我約束的道德品質。
品，人品，一個人的道德操守鑒定。
行，道德的外在表現形式。
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: Vocabulaire européen des philosophies. Dictionnaire des intraduisibles
De differentiis

note.p: 570. Inter Virtutem et fortitudinem. Virtus in animi vigore et habitu est, cujus pars est fortitudo mentis. Quae ex quatuor virtutibus una est, licet et corporis robur fortitudo vocetur.

bibl.title: Lateinische Synonyme und Etymologien

note.p: virtus is virtue insofar as it manifests itself in becoming and meritorious behaviour.
innocentia refers to virtue insofar as it shoes itself in blameless, especially disinterested conduct.
honestas is virtue insofar as it shows itself in virtuous and noble sentiments.

entry.def: The most current dé 德 "virtues" recognised in pre-Buddhist China are rén 仁 "kind-heartedness", yì 義 "rectitude", lǐ 禮 "propriety", zhì 智 "wisdom", and xìn 信 "good faith".

sense.def: proper ritual; proper ritualised moderation
the ritual obligations of the contextually determinate N

entry.def: Further important virtues are xiào 孝"filial piety", zhōng 忠 "loyal diligence", tì 悌/弟 "brotherly affection", lián 廉 "impeccable probity", jié 節 "moderation", and perhaps yǒng 勇 "the courage of one's moral convictions".

Further important virtues are xiào 孝"filial piety", zhōng 忠 "loyal diligence", tì 悌/弟 "brotherly affection", lián 廉 "impeccable probity", jié 節 "moderation", and perhaps yǒng 勇 "the courage of one's moral convictions".

sense.def: filial piety, devotion to one's living parents and dead forbears
filial 孝子 is ubiquitous
in filial piety, through filial piety, for reasons of filial piety
be characterised by feelings of filial piety and a disposition to act on these
be filial; show filial piety
with filial piety, filially

ultimately true filial piety
moral constants, virtues

sense.def: moral purity

entry.def: Further important virtues are xiào 孝"filial piety", zhōng 忠 "loyal diligence", tì 悌/弟 "brotherly affection", lián 廉 "impeccable probity", jié 節 "moderation", and perhaps yǒng 勇 "the courage of one's moral convictions".

sense.def: fraternal love, devotion to one's eldest brother
show devotion to one's eldest brother; more generally: show proper humility towards seniors in general
devoted to one's eldest brother.

fraternal love and respect (especially for the eldest brother)

entry.def: The current general term for salient features and principles of charismatic moral integrity and generosity is dé 德, when used as a term of ethical evalutation; but this word has many other philosophically important meanings.

sense.def: 列德而尚賢 "give rank to men of natural potency/Virtue and honour the worthy": person who is completely commited to his/her natural endowments; person who has realised his/her natural potential
moral potency; commitment to one's natural endowments; cultivation of moral excellence or potency
(considerations of) natural moral qualities (good or bad) 惡德 "evil moral qualities"; concept of moral potency or excellence
potency; natural potential; (potential) power; the natural potential/power that something has by virtue of being in accordance with the Way
唯有德者能之 "only a person possessed of superior virtue is capable of this": (obtained 得) moral excellence; fully developed moral and spiritual potential; superior Virtue
德人 "a person who has realised his natural potential/Virtue": having realised one's natural potential/Virtue, being based on the realisation of one's natural potential/superior virtue
be characterised by charismatic natural potential, by Virtue, by an inherent moral authority
五德“(the) five Virtues": x number of virtues
consider the contextually determinate N as an act of virtue
inner charismatic power or potency of a contextually determinate (kind of) person; somebody's charismatic virtue
make a show to N of being virtuous
王德 "realised charismatic natural potency/Virtue of a king": 1. realised natural potential (of a ruler or a sage); 2. realised natural potential like that of an N
日漸之德 "daily growing natural potential/Virtue" also 至德 "perfect Virtue"!!!: (greater or lesser) (one's) finite moral and spiritual potency; natural potential of excellence and Virtue
supreme natural potency; supreme moral potency; outstanding magical natural endowments; ideal natural potential
"(perfect) realisation of one's potentialities, Virtue"
be (identical with) ideal natural Virtue; be natural excellence
be a matter of Virtue
an N2 of the natural Virtue of an N1
state/degree of prevailing moral virtue in society
Virtue prevails; natural potency is realised
至德"perfect Virtue": a V-ing virtue
by virtue of our moral potency
somebody's moral authority and integrity
by his virtue
民德“degree of moral virtue of the people 风俗道德" social: degree of virtue

The most current dé 德 "virtues" recognised in pre-Buddhist China are rén 仁 "kind-heartedness", yì 義 "rectitude", lǐ 禮 "propriety", zhì 智 "wisdom", and xìn 信 "good faith".

bibl.title: 唐五代語言詞典 Táng Wǔdài yǔyán cídiǎn A Dictionary of the Language of the Tang and Five Dynasties Periods

sense.def: (BUDDH:) (note that in pre-Buddhist Chinese the compound often had a negative connotation, description of Buddhist practice:) brave and fierce > energetic, with all one's might, powerfully, heroicly (this word has an exremely high frequency in Buddhist translations, describing one of the characterstics of a Bodhisattva); skr. vikrānta (also: yǒngjiàn 勇建, mèngjiàn 猛建)

(BUDDH:) (description of Buddhist practice:) bravely and fiercly > energetically, with all one's might, powerfully, heroicly (this word has an exremely high frequency in Buddhist translations, describing one of the characterstics of a Bodhisattva); skr. vikrānta (also: yǒngjiàn 勇建, mèngjiàn 猛建)
